### INTRO You are an ER extraction expert. You will be provided with parts of scientific papers containing words or phrases classifiable with the following categories: protein_type, taxonomy_domain, protein, structure_element, evidence, protein_state, site, chemical, residue_name, experimental_method, species, residue_range, ptm, complex_assembly, mutant, residue_name_number, gene, oligomeric_state, residue_number
### INSTRUCTIONS
You are going to output XML-formatted annotation in the following format.
<annotation entity="ENTITY_NAME" type="ENTITY_CATEGORY"/> <annotation entity="ENTITY_NAME" type="ENTITY_CATEGORY"/> ......

### EXAMPLES Sentence Petal break-strength assays measure the force (expressed in gram equivalents) required to remove the petals from the flower of serk mutant plants compared to haesa/hsl2 mutant and Col-0 wild-type flowers. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="serk" type="gene"/> </RES>
Sentence SDS PAGE analysis of the purified Arabidopsis thaliana HAESA ectodomain (residues 20–620) obtained by secreted expression in insect cells. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="Arabidopsis thaliana" type="species"/> <annotation entity="20–620" type="residue_range"/> </RES>
Sentence A central hydroxyproline residue anchors IDA to the receptor. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="hydroxyproline" type="residue_name"/> </RES>
Sentence Close-up views of (A) IDA, (B) the N-terminally extended PKGV-IDA and (C) IDL1 bound to the HAESA hormone binding pocket (in bonds representation, in yellow) and including simulated annealing 2Fo–Fc omit electron density maps contoured at 1.0 σ. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="PKGV-IDA" type="mutant"/> </RES>
Sentence Crystal structures of HAESA in complex with IDA reveal a hormone binding pocket that accommodates an active dodecamer peptide. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="Crystal structures" type="evidence"/> <annotation entity="in complex with" type="protein_state"/> <annotation entity="hormone binding pocket" type="site"/> <annotation entity="peptide" type="chemical"/> </RES>
Sentence Floral abscission is controlled by the leucine-rich repeat receptor kinase (LRR-RK) HAESA and the peptide hormone IDA. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="HAESA" type="protein"/> </RES>
Sentence For subunit β1, this process was previously inferred to require that the propeptide residue at position (-2) of the subunit precursor occupies the S1 specificity pocket of the substrate-binding channel formed by amino acid 45 (for details see Supplementary Note 2). Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="(-2)" type="residue_number"/> </RES>
Sentence Here we show that IDA is sensed directly by the HAESA ectodomain. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="ectodomain" type="structure_element"/> </RES>
Sentence Mechanistic insight into a peptide hormone signaling complex mediating floral organ abscission Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="peptide hormone" type="protein_type"/> </RES>
Sentence Note that Pro58IDA and Leu67IDA are the first residues defined by electron density when bound to the HAESA ectodomain. (D) Table summaries for equilibrium dissociation constants (Kd), binding enthalpies (ΔH), binding entropies (ΔS) and stoichiometries (N) for different IDA peptides binding to the HAESA ectodomain (± fitting errors; n.d.). Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="Pro58" type="residue_name_number"/> </RES>
Sentence Plants constantly renew during their life cycle and thus require to shed senescent and damaged organs. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="Plants" type="taxonomy_domain"/> </RES>
Sentence Santiago et al. used protein biochemistry, structural biology and genetics to uncover how the IDA hormone activates HAESA. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="protein biochemistry" type="experimental_method"/> </RES>
Sentence The HAESA LRR domain elutes as a monomer (black dotted line), as does the isolated SERK1 ectodomain (blue dotted line). Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="monomer" type="oligomeric_state"/> </RES>
Sentence The IDA-HAESA and SERK1-HAESA complex interfaces are conserved among HAESA and HAESA-like proteins from different plant species. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="IDA-HAESA" type="complex_assembly"/> </RES>
Sentence The N- (residues 20–88) and C-terminal (residues 593–615) capping domains are shown in yellow, the central 21 LRR motifs are in blue and disulphide bonds are highlighted in green (in bonds representation). (C) Structure-based sequence alignment of the 21 leucine-rich repeats in HAESA with the plant LRR consensus sequence shown for comparison. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="disulphide bonds" type="ptm"/> </RES>

### INPUT Extract from the following text: Acetyl-CoA carboxylases are central regulatory hubs of fatty acid metabolism and are important targets for drug development in obesity and cancer.

resps:
Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="Acetyl-CoA carboxylases" type="protein_type"/> </RES>

### OUTPUT
<annotation entity="Acetyl-CoA carboxylases" type="protein_type"/>

resps: 20S proteasome subunits are synthesized in the cytoplasm and then transported to the nucleus. The 20S proteasome is assembled in the nucleus. doc.sentence: Despite displaying similar affinities for XyG, reverse-genetic analysis reveals that SGBP-B is only required for the efficient capture of smaller oligosaccharides, whereas the presence of SGBP-A is more critical than its carbohydrate-binding ability for growth on XyG. Together, these data demonstrate that SGBP-A and SGBP-B play complementary, specialized roles in carbohydrate capture by B. ovatus and elaborate a model of how vegetable xyloglucans are accessed by the Bacteroidetes.

### EXAMPLES Sentence Petal break-strength assays measure the force (expressed in gram equivalents) required to remove the petals from the flower of serk mutant plants compared to haesa/hsl2 mutant and Col-0 wild-type flowers. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="serk" type="gene"/> </RES>
Sentence SDS PAGE analysis of the purified Arabidopsis thaliana HAESA ectodomain (residues 20–620) obtained by secreted expression in insect cells. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="Arabidopsis thaliana" type="species"/> <annotation entity="20–620" type="residue_range"/> </RES>
Sentence A central hydroxyproline residue anchors IDA to the receptor. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="hydroxyproline" type="residue_name"/> </RES>
Sentence Close-up views of (A) IDA, (B) the N-terminally extended PKGV-IDA and (C) IDL1 bound to the HAESA hormone binding pocket (in bonds representation, in yellow) and including simulated annealing 2Fo–Fc omit electron density maps contoured at 1.0 σ. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="PKGV-IDA" type="mutant"/> </RES>
Sentence Crystal structures of HAESA in complex with IDA reveal a hormone binding pocket that accommodates an active dodecamer peptide. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="Crystal structures" type="evidence"/> <annotation entity="in complex with" type="protein_state"/> <annotation entity="hormone binding pocket" type="site"/> <annotation entity="peptide" type="chemical"/> </RES>
Sentence Floral abscission is controlled by the leucine-rich repeat receptor kinase (LRR-RK) HAESA and the peptide hormone IDA. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="HAESA" type="protein"/> </RES>
Sentence For subunit β1, this process was previously inferred to require that the propeptide residue at position (-2) of the subunit precursor occupies the S1 specificity pocket of the substrate-binding channel formed by amino acid 45 (for details see Supplementary Note 2). Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="(-2)" type="residue_number"/> </RES>
Sentence Here we show that IDA is sensed directly by the HAESA ectodomain. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="ectodomain" type="structure_element"/> </RES>

(D) Table summaries for equilibrium dissociation constants (Kd), binding enthalpies (ΔH), binding entropies (ΔS) and stoichiometries (N) for different IDA peptides binding to the HAESA ectodomain (± fitting errors; n.d.). Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="Pro58" type="residue_name_number"/> </RES>
Sentence Plants constantly renew during their life cycle and thus require to shed senescent and damaged organs. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="Plants" type="taxonomy_domain"/> </RES>
Sentence Santiago et al. used protein biochemistry, structural biology and genetics to uncover how the IDA hormone activates HAESA. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="protein biochemistry" type="experimental_method"/> </RES>
Sentence The HAESA LRR domain elutes as a monomer (black dotted line), as does the isolated SERK1 ectodomain (blue dotted line). Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="monomer" type="oligomeric_state"/> </RES>
Sentence The IDA-HAESA and SERK1-HAESA complex interfaces are conserved among HAESA and HAESA-like proteins from different plant species. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="IDA-HAESA" type="complex_assembly"/> </RES>
Sentence The N- (residues 20–88) and C-terminal (residues 593–615) capping domains are shown in yellow, the central 21 LRR motifs are in blue and disulphide bonds are highlighted in green (in bonds representation). (C) Structure-based sequence alignment of the 21 leucine-rich repeats in HAESA with the plant LRR consensus sequence shown for comparison. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="disulphide bonds" type="ptm"/> </RES>

doc.sentence: Here, the authors report the crystal structures of closed states of Mep2 proteins and propose a model for their regulation by comparing them with the open ammonium transporters of bacteria.

target: <annotations><annotation entity='crystal structures' type='evidence'></annotation><annotation entity='closed' type='protein_state'></annotation><annotation entity='Mep2 proteins' type='protein_type'></annotation><annotation entity='by comparing them with' type='experimental_method'></annotation><annotation entity='open' type='protein_state'></annotation><annotation entity='ammonium transporters' type='protein_type'></annotation><annotation entity='bacteria' type='taxonomy_domain'></annotation></annotations>

### INTRO You are an ER extraction expert. You will be provided with parts of scientific papers containing words or phrases classifiable with the following categories: protein_type, taxonomy_domain, protein, structure_element, evidence, protein_state, site, chemical, residue_name, experimental_method, species, residue_range, ptm, complex_assembly, mutant, residue_name_number, gene, oligomeric_state, residue_number
### INSTRUCTIONS
You are going to output XML-formatted annotation in the following format.
<annotation entity="ENTITY_NAME" type="ENTITY_CATEGORY"/> <annotation entity="ENTITY_NAME" type="ENTITY_CATEGORY"/> ......

### EXAMPLES Sentence Petal break-strength assays measure the force (expressed in gram equivalents) required to remove the petals from the flower of serk mutant plants compared to haesa/hsl2 mutant and Col-0 wild-type flowers. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="serk" type="gene"/> </RES>
Sentence SDS PAGE analysis of the purified Arabidopsis thaliana HAESA ectodomain (residues 20–620) obtained by secreted expression in insect cells. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="Arabidopsis thaliana" type="species"/> <annotation entity="20–620" type="residue_range"/> </RES>
Sentence A central hydroxyproline residue anchors IDA to the receptor. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="hydroxyproline" type="residue_name"/> </RES>
Sentence Close-up views of (A) IDA, (B) the N-terminally extended PKGV-IDA and (C) IDL1 bound to the HAESA hormone binding pocket (in bonds representation, in yellow) and including simulated annealing 2Fo–Fc omit electron density maps contoured at 1.0 σ. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="PKGV-IDA" type="mutant"/> </RES>
Sentence Crystal structures of HAESA in complex with IDA reveal a hormone binding pocket that accommodates an active dodecamer peptide. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="Crystal structures" type="evidence"/> <annotation entity="in complex with" type="protein_state"/> <annotation entity="hormone binding pocket" type="site"/> <annotation entity="peptide" type="chemical"/> </RES>
Sentence Floral abscission is controlled by the leucine-rich repeat receptor kinase (LRR-RK) HAESA and the peptide hormone IDA. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="HAESA" type="protein"/> </RES>
Sentence For subunit β1, this process was previously inferred to require that the propeptide residue at position (-2) of the subunit precursor occupies the S1 specificity pocket of the substrate-binding channel formed by amino acid 45 (for details see Supplementary Note 2). Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="(-2)" type="residue_number"/> </RES>
Sentence Here we show that IDA is sensed directly by the HAESA ectodomain. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="ectodomain" type="structure_element"/> </RES>
Sentence Mechanistic insight into a peptide hormone signaling complex mediating floral organ abscission Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="peptide hormone" type="protein_type"/> </RES>
Sentence Note that Pro58IDA and Leu67IDA are the first residues defined by electron density when bound to the HAESA ectodomain. (D) Table summaries for equilibrium dissociation constants (Kd), binding enthalpies (ΔH), binding entropies (ΔS) and stoichiometries (N) for different IDA peptides binding to the HAESA ectodomain (± fitting errors; n.d.). Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="Pro58" type="residue_name_number"/> </RES>
Sentence Plants constantly renew during their life cycle and thus require to shed senescent and damaged organs. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="Plants" type="taxonomy_domain"/> </RES>
Sentence Santiago et al. used protein biochemistry, structural biology and genetics to uncover how the IDA hormone activates HAESA. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="protein biochemistry" type="experimental_method"/> </RES>
Sentence The HAESA LRR domain elutes as a monomer (black dotted line), as does the isolated SERK1 ectodomain (blue dotted line). Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="monomer" type="oligomeric_state"/> </RES>
Sentence The IDA-HAESA and SERK1-HAESA complex interfaces are conserved among HAESA and HAESA-like proteins from different plant species. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="IDA-HAESA" type="complex_assembly"/> </RES>
Sentence The N- (residues 20–88) and C-terminal (residues 593–615) capping domains are shown in yellow, the central 21 LRR motifs are in blue and disulphide bonds are highlighted in green (in bonds representation). (C) Structure-based sequence alignment of the 21 leucine-rich repeats in HAESA with the plant LRR consensus sequence shown for comparison. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="disulphide bonds" type="ptm"/> </RES>

### INPUT Extract from the following text: Here, the authors report the crystal structures of closed states of Mep2 proteins and propose a model for their regulation by comparing them with the open ammonium transporters of bacteria.

resps:
The authors used X-ray crystallography to determine the crystal structures of Mep2 proteins in their closed states. Annotations

The authors propose a model for the regulation of Mep2 proteins based on the crystal structures of their closed states. Annotations ### OUTPUT ### INSTRUCTIONS You are to extract the annotations from the provided text. **Please follow the same format

### INPUT Extract from the following text: Here, we report the crystal structures of YfiB alone and of an active mutant YfiBL43P complexed with YfiR with 2:2 stoichiometry.

resps:
The YfiB structure reveals a novel fold with a central cavity. The YfiBL43P complex reveals a new binding site for YfiR.
The YfiBL43P complex structure is consistent with a model of YfiR binding to YfiB.
We also show that YfiR binding to YfiB is dependent on the presence of a specific residue at position 43 of YfiB.
The YfiBL43P complex structure provides insights into the mechanism of YfiR-mediated YfiB activation.

Annotations ### OUTPUT

doc.sentence: Plants can shed their leaves, flowers or other organs when they no longer need them. But how does a leaf or a flower know when to let go? A receptor protein called HAESA is found on the surface of the cells that surround a future break point on the plant. When its time to shed an organ, a hormone called IDA instructs HAESA to trigger the shedding process.
doc.annotations: <annotations><annotation entity='Plants' type='taxonomy_domain'></annotation><annotation entity='receptor protein' type='protein_type'></annotation><annotation entity='HAESA' type='protein'></annotation><annotation entity='hormone' type='chemical'></annotation><annotation entity='IDA' type='protein'></annotation><annotation entity='HAESA' type='protein'></annotation></annotations>

target: <annotations><annotation entity='Plants' type='taxonomy_domain'></annotation><annotation entity='receptor protein' type='protein_type'></annotation><annotation entity='HAESA' type='protein'></annotation><annotation entity='hormone' type='chemical'></annotation><annotation entity='IDA' type='protein'></annotation><annotation entity='HAESA' type='protein'></annotation></annotations>

doc.sentence: Structural analyses revealed that in contrast to the compact conformation of the dimeric YfiB alone, YfiBL43P adopts a stretched conformation allowing activated YfiB to penetrate the peptidoglycan (PG) layer and access YfiR. YfiBL43P shows a more compact PG-binding pocket and much higher PG binding affinity than wild-type YfiB, suggesting a tight correlation between PG binding and YfiB activation.

doc.sentence: The Bacteroidetes are dominant bacteria in the human gut that are responsible for the digestion of the complex polysaccharides that constitute “dietary fiber.” Although this symbiotic relationship has been appreciated for decades, little is currently known about how Bacteroidetes seek out and bind plant cell wall polysaccharides as a necessary first step in their metabolism.

Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="PKGV-IDA" type="mutant"/> </RES>

Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="Crystal structures" type="evidence"/> <annotation entity="in complex with" type="protein_state"/> <annotation entity="hormone binding pocket" type="site"/> <annotation entity="peptide" type="chemical"/> </RES>

Sentence The N- (residues 20–88) and C-terminal (residues 593–615) capping domains are shown in yellow, the central 21 LRR motifs are in blue and disulphide bonds are highlighted in green (in bonds representation). (C) Structure-based sequence alignment of the 21 leucine-rich repeats in HAESA with the plant LRR consensus sequence shown for comparison. Annotations <RES> <annotation entity="disulphide bonds" type="ptm"/> </RES>
